oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Herd-based Testing for the Preventive Medicine Practice
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Oetzel, Garrett R.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: metabolic
nutritional disease
herd-based data
ruminal pH
blood β-hydroxybutyrate
ketone tests
on-esterified fatty acids
blood calcium
urinary pH
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Strategies have been developed to diagnose and monitor key metabolic and nutritional diseases in dairy herds. Veterinary technicians can play a key role in gathering and managing the herd-based data needed. Tests that can be used include ruminal pH (for subacute ruminal acidosis), blood β-hydroxybutyrate (for subclinical ketosis), cowside ketone tests (for identifying individual cases of ketosis), blood non-esterified fatty acids (for evaluating energy balance on pre-fresh cows), blood calcium (for parturient hypocalcemia) and urinary pH (for monitoring acidification of pre-fresh cows to prevent hypocalcemia).
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2005; 133-138
